TestCase.TestCaseObjective: BSO validation. Test whether the Producer/Provider is able to create and update the status information of a Task (AttackByFire for instance) and the Consumers/Receivers are able to understand (and display) it correctly.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: The Producer creates a Task (AttackByFire) with specific status information. The Consumers receive the information and interpret it correctly. The Producer updates the status information of this AttackByFire. The Consumers receive the information and interpret it correctly.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R, P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: The Producer/Provider has created a topic which includes message elements belonging to the Task message schema area. The Consumers have subscribed to this topic.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: This test is considered a success if the AttackByFire and its status information is processed and interpreted correctly on all Nations' C2IS.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction:
The Producer (1) creates a Task (AttackByFire) with name XXX_TSI_002 and with the following status information: * HostilityStatusCode=Unknown * CompletionPercent=0
Notices: XXX in name of the object is meant (in principle) to be replaced by the 3 letter code of the country name. Example for the name of the Task: GBR_ TSI_002
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumers (2) receive and display the AttackByFire correctly.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: The Producer (1) updates the AttackByFire with the following status information: * HostilityStatus=Hostile * CompletionPercent=1
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumers (2) receive and display the AttackByFire correctly.
